info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:35PM EST until December 22 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG WINTER STORM WILL CREATE MULTIPLE HAZARDS ACROSS THE REGION... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain expected. A light glaze of ice is expected. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible, with wind chill values as low as 20 below zero. Winds will likely gust over 40 mph Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * WHERE...Indiana County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to Noon EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday morning through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Strong winds on Friday may result in damage to trees and power lines, resulting in scattered power outages. Winds may gust over 40 mph Friday afternoon through Saturday evening.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
